The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the Securities Act of 1933 have been amended to give the Commission the authority to prohibit individuals who have violated certain regulations from serving as officers or directors of registered issuers. RETALIATION AGAINST INFORMANT. Amends Section 1513 of title 18, United States Code to penalize retaliation against informants providing truthful information to law enforcement officers regarding Federal offenses. Penalties include fines or imprisonment up to 10 years.
